alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:42PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL ROOSEVELT AND SOUTHEASTERN DE BACA COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM MDT... At 641 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Taiban, or 18 miles southeast of Fort Sumner, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Roosevelt and southeastern De Baca Counties. This includes Highway 60 near Mile Marker 332. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
